title: No hope of a U-turn: why smart motorways are here to stay despite safety fears
text:
The Government this week sidestepped a written parliamentary question from Lord Goodlad. “What plans does it have for the future of smart motorways?” asked the former Conservative chief whip and Australian High Commissioner.

Baroness Vere of Norbiton didn’t really answer the question but said the country’s motorway strategy for 2020 to 2025 would be published shortly. Perhaps ominously, the transport minister did not rule out further expansion of the controversial roads concept.

Smart motorways, which in one form or another dispense with the hard shoulder and implement variable speed limits, have attracted waves of criticism in recent weeks.

Highways England aims to have 15 sections in place...
